newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss sight deposits rise to 3,853.7 million Sfr.
newsitem.headline: Swiss sight deposits rise to 3,853.7 million Sfr.

text.p: The Swiss National Bank said sight deposits rose 460.0 million Swiss francs to 3.85 billion in the reporting period ended March 27.
Statement of March 27 in millions of Swiss francs:
Borrowing at the emergency Lombard window fell by 11.2 million francs to 1.0 million in the reporting period.
Outstanding borrowing via the discount facility and swaps of money market certificates rose by 298.2 million francs to 1,762.8 million.
An SNB spokesman said the level of sight deposits reflected month and quarter-end liquidity needs. The needs had been met without particular problems, the spokesman aded.
The SNB also said a revision of its accounting standards announced on March 27 had brought some immediate alterations in the end of quarter statements on reserves.
Foreign currency reserves and tradable securities will now be adjusted to market values at the end of each quarter.
For example, the SNB said the dollar was revalued at 1.4582 Swiss francs at the end of the first quarter as against 1.3500 at the end of the previous quarter on December 31, 1996.
Only the reserve statements at the end of each quarter will undergo a revaluation. The other statements, which come about every 10 days, will use the most recent values.
The SNB said last week it was adopting new accounting guidelines in line with "true and fair" principles.
